content:
I've amended the puzzle statement based on the forum comment ( https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-maze-w-teleporters-and-jumps/197527/13 ) and addressed several other things. The main updates are:

Goal
* Rewrote "How teleporters work" as a general description instead of relying on an example.

* Updated "How jump pods work": Replaced "2 steps" with "2 cells", and removed the word "Example".

* Removed "Letter v will not be used as a teleporter." It's now covered in the Constraints section.

* Expanded the last paragraph (originally just "Allowed moves are Up, Down, Left and Right, no diagonal moves") to clarify how steps are counted.

Output
* Explicitly added -1 as a possible output (it was previously mentioned in the Goal section only).

Constraints
* Lowered the minimum dimensions of 5 to 3 as Test 2 and Validator 2 violated the old limit.

* Added the last three constraints.

Cases
* Fixed Teleporter maze (Validator 4) which had two "U" exits but no matching "u" entry (reported by @Yatech below).
I think there is a typo in "Teleporter maze - validator" - it contains two uppercase 'U'.

There's a validator with a jump combo that leads straight to a teleport, and the corresponding testcase only has the jump combo without the teleport.
Maybe add a similar testcase.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is clear, the tests manage to cover the different aspects described in the statement and the difficulty seems coherent with similar puzzles :thumbsup:

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: .

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Now everything is ok for me. Nice maze puzzle. I like the idea about jumps and teleporters.

I think there is an error with "Jumps and teleports - validator", you're expecting 8 but i find 7 by going up :

################
######E#########
#_>____#y#<#<#<#
################
#^#^###______#^#
#_#_#x#______###
#Y#_##########^#
###X#^#<#<#<#<S#
################

################
######7#########
#34_456#1#1#1#1#
################
#3#^###______#1#
#2#_#x#______###
#1#_##########1#
###X#^#<#<#<#<S#
################

Did i miss something ?
I'm good with all other tests and validators.

If you like mazes i'm creating "Hexagonal Maze part2", do you want me to tell you when it won't be private ?

"Make sure to copy/paste character ˅ it's not a letter v on the keyboard" : is it an ascii character ? I think there might be a problem in some languages. For example, "string" in C is a 8-bits char table. You should use the "v" letter on the keyboard, and exclude this letter for the teleporters.

Teleporters and jumps are a good idea.

I'd probably explicitly state the allowed moves (north, south, east, west, no diagonal moves etc.) and also mention the fact that you can walk through exit teleports (cf. Don't take it - validator). Cool puzzle.
done, thanks for the advice :)
Thanks for the advice. Updated the contribution, now it says "Letter v will not be used as a teleporter." instead.

I think I missed something, it should be 7 it seems
I'll do more debugging..
Thank you so much for testing it out.

And yeah sure I would love to see hexagonal maze, I solved the first one the other day and I loved it :)
Good catch! Fixed.

Thank you ^^

Ok, it's 8 steps because you start at 0 (0->7 makes 8 moves).
I think you miss the '>'jump (my n°4).
You should have 3 instead of 4, 4 instead of 5 ... and 6 at the end. So 7 moves.

(i always test before approve ... and i have to approve : it's a maze)
Or maybe the 'y' solution is written first, then you write the 'x' solution, overwriting the 'y' one.
yes I think some overwriting is in action, just need to see where and why
Did you forget to test if you have already visited a cell ?

My code works similarly, but i put the number on jumps and teleporters too.
Sh** ... i wanted to show you my code but it disapeared ... i'll need to rewrite it :(
My hexagonal maze part2 is nearly ready : https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/31365d8104c3c0d6153260fd2479c0e644872

I love the puzzle, although not sure if I'm good enough to solve it :')
I managed to to build DFS for it without keys/doors so far, so Example-s work
I'll continue trying to solve it and we'll see ^^

EDIT:
oh you can go back after collecting the key? this breaks my attempt at solution apart :(

EDIT:
Not giving up, came up with keys hash, so if the cell is not visited with keys-hash it can be visited again. Hopefully I can make it work :)

EDIT:
Works now for "Need the key" and validator, doesn't work for "Choose shortest" :/
Not sure what else to do to make it work

The state "already visited" need to be computed with the keys, and not only x y. For the "shortest", you just have to end at the first solution found with a BFS. With a DFS, you may need to count the number of step, and choose the solution with less step.

I managed to fix my algorithm for tests with keys, like  "Need the key" and  "Choose shortest".. took me a long time to debug it

Now it fails on the "Sliding junction" :(
But I might have an idea how to fix that as well.. I'm guessing my "visited" logic is again flawed

As you can see I'm not the best at this, takes me some time to solve harder puzzles
If it can helps you, i don't flag as "visited" cells when i just slide. Only the last cell of a move is "visited".

Yes I think I got it, works now for "Sliding junction"

But doesn't work for "Sliding until wall" :D
your test cases are very well defined, hopefully I can solve it and approve ;)
Thank you ^^ maybe you stopped sliding on the wall and not "in front of".

I fixed it to stop in front of a wall, now getting process timeout :/
I think I "hit the wall" here :D
Not sure what to do now, I'll try debugging more..

Now I got everything to work until "Skating rink" (no solution found for me)
Weirdly enough "Skating rink" - validator works for me

For "Skating rink with keys" I get:
Found: UL R L DR UR UL UR UL DL DR DL DL UR R DR DL
Expected: UL R L DR UR UL L UL DL DR DL DL UR R DR DL
Difference in one move..

And for validator for SRWK I get no solution again

Could you check the "SRWK" and see if I'm wrong or I found another path?

Hehe nice :D
Wish I knew why I get "no solution" for the other two..
This is becoming harder and harder to debug

can you also confirm that there actually is solution for the other two that I'm getting no solution for?

The "Skating rink" - test and "Skating rink with keys" - validator?
just wondering if my algorithm actually works proper and you got a mistake :P

Yes there are solutions. The expected solutions are good.

But there was a bug in my "complete algorithm" supposed to give all solutions (because of optimizations done for the "normal algorithm" supposed to find the best one). Actually there are 2 solutions for "skating rink - test" and 10 for "skating rink with keys - test".
We should continue this conversation on my contribution.
I'll try to do the puzzle before giving approbation (if not approved before).
I've updated the contribution, now it includes jumps as well :)
Thanks for letting me know, it was a bit tricky but I fixed my old solution :). I guess I can give you the last approval vote, it's a nice one.
